content:
The Act may be cited as the "Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act". The Tropical Forest Conservation Act of 1998 is amended to include coral reefs and associated coastal marine ecosystems, highlighting their benefits such as harboring diverse species and supporting pharmaceutical development and marine tourism. The Tropical Forest Conservation Act of 1998 is amended to include coral reefs and associated coastal marine ecosystems, recognizing their importance in providing food, jobs, and storm protection for coastal communities. The Tropical Forest Conservation Act of 1998 is amended to include coral reefs and associated coastal marine ecosystems, recognizing their importance in providing food, jobs, and storm protection for coastal communities. The amendment also addresses unsustainable exploitation of coral reefs and coastal marine ecosystems. The Tropical Forest Conservation Act of 1998 is amended to include coral reefs and coastal marine ecosystems due to their significance in providing food, jobs, and storm protection for coastal communities. The amendment also aims to address the unsustainable exploitation of these ecosystems. Section 803 of the Tropical Forest Conservation Act of 1998 is amended to include coral reefs and coastal marine ecosystems, addressing their unsustainable exploitation and recognizing their importance for coastal communities. The Tropical Forest Conservation Act of 1998 is amended to include coral reefs and coastal marine ecosystems in conservation agreements and facilities. The term 'Conservation Fund' refers to a fund provided for in section 810. 'Coral' includes various species of the phylum Cnidaria. 'Coral reef' is defined as any reef primarily composed of corals. SEC. 4. The Tropical Forest Conservation Act of 1988 is amended to establish a Conservation Facility.

SEC. 5. Eligibility for benefits now includes coral reef and associated coastal marine ecosystems.

SEC. 6. Debt owed to the United States as a result of concessional loans can be reduced under the Foreign Assistance Act of 1961. The Tropical Forest Conservation Act of 1998 is amended to change the name of the fund to Conservation Fund and authorize appropriations for fiscal years 2007 through 2011. Up to $300,000 is authorized for audits, evaluations, monitoring, and administration of programs under this part. SEC. 7 amends the Tropical Forest Conservation Act of 1998 by changing the name of the fund to Conservation Fund. SEC. 8 addresses United States government representation on oversight bodies for grants from debt-for-nature swaps and debt-buybacks. Section 808(a)(5) of the Tropical Forest Conservation Act of 1998 is amended to allow individuals appointed by the United States Government to serve on the administering body overseeing grants from debt-for-nature swaps or debt buy-backs, regardless of the U.S. being a party to any agreement with the beneficiary country. The Tropical Forest Conservation Act of 1998 is amended to change the authority of the Secretary of State, update the administering body's responsibilities, and modify eligible activities. The Tropical Forest Conservation Act of 1998 is amended to include coral reefs and coastal marine ecosystems, update grant recipient qualifications, and expand eligible activities. The Tropical Forest Conservation Act of 1998 is amended to include coral reefs and coastal marine ecosystems in grant activities, with larger grants requiring approval from the US and beneficiary country governments. Additionally, a conforming amendment changes the section heading from "tropical forest" to "conservation". SEC. 10. CONSERVATION FUND amended to change terms to "Conservation Agreement" and "Conservation Fund". SEC. 11. BOARD repealed. SEC. 12. ANNUAL REPORTS TO THE CONGRESS. SEC. 12 of the Tropical Forest Conservation Act of 1998 is amended to change reporting deadlines from December 31 to April 15 and replace "fiscal year" with "calendar year." Subsection (b) is removed. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to include coral reefs and coastal marine ecosystems. The Tropical Forest Conservation Act of 1998 is renamed the Tropical Forest and Coral Conservation Act of 2009. Sections 812 and are redesignated in the Foreign Assistance Act. The Foreign Assistance Act of 1961 is amended to include coral reefs and coastal marine ecosystems. Section 703(a)(5) is also amended to update language regarding structural adjustment facilities and Fund monitored programs.
